private_information: I can only pick up and place blocks whose labels are vowels.
Vowel blocks among the set are A, E, I.
I can only interact with the top block of any stack.
I can move only one block at a time.
vowel_agent.goal: Collaborate to rearrange the blocks into the target single stack with M on the table and A on top of B as specified by the global goal.

private_information: I can only pick up and place blocks whose labels are consonants.
Consonant blocks among the set are B, C, D, F, G, H, J, K, L, M.
I can only interact with the top block of any stack.
I can move only one block at a time.
consonant_agent.goal: Collaborate to rearrange the blocks into the target single stack with M on the table and A on top of B as specified by the global goal.

private_information: I coordinate the two agents and integrate their local plans into a single PDDL domain and problem.
The final PDDL must be compatible with the FastDownwards planner.
All agent actions should remain distinct and attributable to the originating agent.
orchestrator.goal: Produce a combined PDDL domain and PDDL problem that achieves the global block stacking goal and is ready for FastDownwards.

public_information: There are blocks labeled K, C, D, M, F, H, A, E, L, I, J, G, B.
Blocks are arranged in stacks on a table.
Agents may only pick up or place blocks that are currently at the top of a stack.
Agents may only manipulate one block at a time.
One agent is restricted to moving vowel-labeled blocks and the other agent is restricted to moving consonant-labeled blocks.
Initial stack configuration is as follows. Stack 1 bottom to top: K, F, J, B. Stack 2 is C on the table. Stack 3 bottom to top: D, E, I. Stack 4 bottom to top: M, H, A, L, G.
The goal configuration is a single tower with A on B, B on C, C on D, D on E, E on F, F on G, G on H, H on I, I on J, J on K, K on L, L on M, and M on the table.

pddl.system_prompt: You are the vowel-moving agent. You are allowed to move only vowel-labeled blocks. Provide a clear, ordered, step-by-step list of the moves you intend to perform. Do not produce PDDL. Describe each move in the form 'move X from Y to Z' where X is a vowel block and Y and Z are stack descriptors or table. Only include moves that involve vowel blocks and that respect the rule that you may only manipulate top blocks one at a time.
pddl.prompt: You are vowel_agent. Use the following public environment facts and your private knowledge to produce your local action sequence as a plain text plan. Public facts: {environment->public_information}. Your private information: {agents->vowel_agent->private_information}. Global goal: {agents->vowel_agent->goal}. Think step by step and list the moves you will perform. If information is missing, restrict your plan to actions you can determine from the information you have.

pddl.system_prompt: You are the consonant-moving agent. You are allowed to move only consonant-labeled blocks. Provide a clear, ordered, step-by-step list of the moves you intend to perform. Do not produce PDDL. Describe each move in the form 'move X from Y to Z' where X is a consonant block and Y and Z are stack descriptors or table. Only include moves that involve consonant blocks and that respect the rule that you may only manipulate top blocks one at a time.
pddl.prompt: You are consonant_agent. Use the following public environment facts and your private knowledge to produce your local action sequence as a plain text plan. Public facts: {environment->public_information}. Your private information: {agents->consonant_agent->private_information}. Global goal: {agents->consonant_agent->goal}. Think step by step and list the moves you will perform. If information is missing, restrict your plan to actions you can determine from the information you have.

pddl.system_prompt: You are the orchestrator. Receive the two agents' plain-text local plans and integrate them into a single multi-agent PDDL domain and a PDDL problem file suitable for the FastDownwards planner. Keep the actions of the two agents distinct by prefixing actions with the agent name or otherwise ensuring traceability. Produce a domain and a problem that model the block world constraints including top-only moves, one-block-at-a-time actions, agent-specific action preconditions restricting which blocks each agent may move, and the goal stacks as provided. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain> and </domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem> and </problem> tags. Ensure the PDDL is syntactically compatible with FastDownwards.
pddl.prompt: You are orchestrator. Integrate the following inputs into a final PDDL domain and problem for FastDownwards. The global goal to achieve: {agents->orchestrator->goal}. Vowel agent plan: {plan_vowel}. Consonant agent plan: {plan_consonant}. Public facts: {environment->public_information}. Private facts about agents: {agents->vowel_agent->private_information} and {agents->consonant_agent->private_information}. Keep agent actions distinct and compatible with a multi-agent execution model. Think step by step and output a complete PDDL domain and a PDDL problem. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain> and </domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem> and </problem> tags.
